text:
Image:Purpleflower_Violet.JPG|thumb|The Violet flower
Violet is the sixth color of the rainbow--it is the color on the inner edge of the rainbow. Violet is the color between blue and purple. The name of the color comes from the violet, which is a small flower grown in most parts of the world.
The first written use of "violet" as a color name in English was in 1370.
